Billy Horschel said he didn't do anything special on Sunday for his 1st-ever win @MemorialGolf. It was still a memorable moment for the 35-yr-old pro who snagged the 6th Tour win of his 13-yr career. #memorialtournament 

https://t.co/jf8x9PfTQo https://t.co/rNMw3fhktY

It's official: Billy Horschel hangs on to win the 47th annual @MemorialGolf Tournament. He shot even par for the round which included a 52-foot eagle putt on par-5, No. 15. Full recap to come. #memorialtournament
Memorial update: Rickie Fowler and Patrick Reed are done. Fowler limps to a +5 on the day and +8 overall. Reed shoots a +3 for the round and +6 overall. #memorialtournament

Back @MemorialGolf for the final round and we've got a few guys who've finished up the tourney, most notably Viktor Hovland, the OWGR's No. 7, who shot -1 for the round but ended +5 overall. #memorialtournament

A man who professes that he needs to slow down a little bit more and quit being "an idiot" and listen to his caddy had quite the day on Jack's course today. #memorialtournament 

https://t.co/g666kqNiC9
Great stuff from our man, as usual! #memorialtournament https://t.co/NMzLmcEBQa

Notables who've finished: Daniel Berger (-5 round, -7 overall, Tied-for 6th). Jon Rahm (+1, -1, T-38). Jordan Spieth (-3, -3, T-19). Jason Day (-4, -3, T-19). Viktor Hovland (+6, +6, T-64). Max Homa (-2, -3, T-19). Matt Kuchar (E, +1, T-49). #memorialtournament
Patrick Cantlay, WOWüò≥ Just put a 64-foot eagle putt on a downhill slope in the bottom of the cupüí™ Now at -6, four strokes off of Billy Horschel's lead. #memorialtournament

Westerville resident Jason Day had a solid third round and said he's been feeling about as good as he's felt in a long time. #memorialtournament

https://t.co/lEYeIogSSE https://t.co/gIDSlwfYRx
Australian native and current Westerville, OH resident Jason Day birdies No. 18 to come in at -4 for the round and -3 overall. More to come from him on his third round. #memorialtournament

Official word from PGA Tour Chief Ref Steve Rintoul regarding Hideki Matsuyama's DQ from the #MemorialTournament: There was a white substance thickly painted onto the face of one of his clubs that could've altered his shots, disqualifying him. Full story from Rintoul to come.

Hideki Matsuyama has been disqualified from the @MemorialGolf tournament. Specifics are scant at this time but they're saying he was DQ'd due to an equipment change during his round. More to come. #MemorialTournament

#MemorialTournament update: the Camerons (Young and Smith), Luke List and K.H. Lee your early leaders at -5. Other notables: Will Zalatoris (-4), 2016 champ William McGirt, Max Homa &  Keegan Bradley all at -3. Jordan Spieth, Adam Scott & Rickie Fowler at -2.
Cameron Young birdies 2 of last 3 holes to come in at -5 and an early @MemorialGolf tourney lead. His recap coming soon. #memorialtournament

Leaderboard update @MemorialGolf: Cameron Young, who was 5-under after his 1st 9 holes, has bogeyed twice on the 2nd 9 and now tied for 2nd w/ several others including Jordan Spieth, Cameron Smith and former champ William McGirt. Will Zalatoris in front at -4 thru 11.
Back home for the next few days #memorialtournament @MemorialGolf https://t.co/N1JKXl7GDX

Ohio State 2022 post spring game presser featuring HC Ryan Day, DC Jim Knowles, QB CJ Stroud, DE JT Tuimoloau & RB Evan Pryor.

https://t.co/Px8yH5QS82
@SportsfanaticMB @OhioStateFB Here are you, sir! https://t.co/H8vb6vyphA

And the 2022 @OhioStateFB spring game comes to a close as the Scarlet beats the Gray, 34-26. Be sure to check out our FB page and YouTube channel for postgame interviews with Ryan Day and select players!
Gray staying in the fight as Jr CB Cameron Kittle plays great defense and deflects Brown's pass to fellow true frosh WR Caleb Burton and comes up the 3-pt INT. 34-26 Scarlet w/ 3 mins to go.
JT Tuimoloau puts a silly spin move on true frosh LT George Fitzpatrick and tags Devin Brown for an 8-yd sack and gives the gray 2 more points. 34-16 w/ 10:10 to go.
True frosh QB Devin Brown playing solid in his first-ever college-type of action. he's 8-of-13, 108 yds, 1 TD, 0 Int
4th quarter will be a running clock. It was announced earlier in the week it would be a 10-minute clock but the scoreboard currently reads 12:00.
End of the 3rd qtr, Scarlet leads the Gray, 34-14
Attendance announced for the 2022 @OhioStateFB spring game: 60,007
Devin Brown w/ a nice flip pass over Trayanum's head to Evan Pryor out of the backfield for 35 yds as Trayanum chested up Pryor but Pryor sped right by him wide open up the left side.

Seeing a lot of young talent on the field for the #Buckeyes in the 2nd right now. True frosh LBs like No. 11 CJ Hicks & No. 36 Gabe Powers. DE Caden Curry. SAF Andre Turrentine. Also AZ St. RB transfer "Chip" Trayanum, who's making the switch to LB.
2nd half starting up and it'll be a 12 minute clock as the 2's take the field.
1st half stats for the Gray of the 2022 @OhioStateFB spring game. https://t.co/g5zmQMjNU9
1st half stats for the Scarlet of the 2022 @OhioStateFB spring game. https://t.co/R8adkr3fdM

Good tribute for Dwayne Haskins playing on the jumbotron right now at halftime of the spring game. Showing a lot of the highlights form his 2018 season as well as the infamous clip of him as an 11-yr-old on video saying how awesome Ohio State was and going to go to college there.
1st half of the @OhioStateFB spring game comes to a close w/ the Scarlet (offense) leading the Gray (defense), 24-9.
Kye Stokes = Dangerous. 2nd pass breakup of the game as he closes in a Stroud pass off to the left side meant for Harrison, Jr.
Stroud threw a little behind Egbuka but he made a great adjustment to come back for the 11-yd 1st down.

True frosh SAF Kye Stokes showing why he's only 1 of 2 early enrollees to lose their black stripe this spring as he closed on a pass intended for WR Sam Wiglusz from true frosh QB Devin Brown. Great closing speed to break it up.
JACK. SAWYER. Following up a nice true frosh season by "sacking" Stroud for a 6-yd loss to give the Gray 7 pts in the game. 24-7 Scarlet w/ 1:31 to go, 2nd qtr.
Gray playing some solid D today. Stroud couldn't find anyone open, threw to Chop in the flat and true soph CB Jordan Hancock was immediately on him for a nice open-field tackle for a 4-yd loss.
RS Soph Kicker Jake Siebert knocks down a 42-yard FG w/ 2:29 to go in the 2nd qtr to give the Scarlet a 24-5 lead.
LB Mitchell Melton hits the turf and is slow to get up. He's now limping off the field. The RS Soph was out all last year w/ an injury.
CHOP ü™ì RB Miyan Williams slips around the right end and busts off a 36-yd run into Gray territory to the 29.
Evan Pryor showing some flash as he weaves his way to a 22-yd TD run, breaking away from 3 tackles along the way. 21-5 Scarlet leads the Gray.
Denzel Burke just showed why he's going to be even more dangerous this upcoming season as he swats away a deep corner route from Stroud to Harrison, Jr.
Correction: No. 74 Donovan Jackson got the start over Vimahi. However, Jackson was replaced by Vimahi for a series in the 2nd qtr.
Stroud completes a 10-yd laser over the middle to Gee Scott, Jr. in between Hickman and Eichenberg. Crazy way to thread the needle on that one.
Starters for this year's @OhioStateFB spring game: https://t.co/XJ1cq0qxWo
Nice 24-yd TD catch by TE Joe Royer who split two defenders and went up to make a solid snag from Kyle McCord and held onto it despite taking a shot from true frosh CB Jyaire Brown.

Joe Royer, RS Soph TE out of Cincinnati Elder HS, slips through the D on a play action bootleg for a nice 13-yd catch then follows it up w/ a 24-yd TD catch from Kyle McCord. 14-2 Offense (scarlet) over Defense (gray).
And the "kickoff" is underway as true freshman K Jayden Fielding kicks to WR Emeka Egbuka at the goal line where Egbuka "called" for a fair catch. They were the only two players on the field.
Just moments away from kickoff of the 2022 @OhioStateFB spring game! We're bringing you everything as it happens.
